StateFieldRegistry

class lib.registry.StateFieldRegistry

Bases: object

Collection of loggable fields, constants, functions, and devices Accessible to every element of pfs

__init__()

Variables common across our pfs Vars in the “vars” object get logged

__weakref__

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

all_off(exceptions=None, override_default_exceptions=False) → None

Turns all components off automatically, except for Antenna Deployer. Calls power_off for every key in self.devices. Except for those in exceptions parameter :param exceptions: (list) components to not turn off, default is [“Antenna Deployer, IMU”] :param override_default_exceptions: (bool) whether or not to use default exceptions :return: None

all_on(exceptions=None) → None

Turns all components on automatically, except for Antenna Deployer. Calls power_on for every key in self.devices except for those in exceptions parameter :param exceptions: components to not turn on, default is [“Antenna Deployer, IMU”] :type exceptions: list

check_lower_threshold() → bool

Checks upper battery threshold for switching modes Syncs voltage to integrated charge if necessary :return: whether switch is required :rtype: bool

check_upper_threshold() → bool

Checks upper battery threshold for switching modes Syncs voltage to integrated charge if necessary :return: whether switch is required :rtype: bool

clear_logs() → None

WARNING: CLEARS ALL LOGGED DATA, ONLY USE FOR TESTING/DEBUG

dump() → None

Dump values of all state fields into state_field_log and readable log

enter_eclipse() → None

Update LAST_ECLIPSE_ENTRY and log new data

enter_sunlight() → None

Update LAST_DAYLIGHT_ENTRY and log new data

load() → lib.registry.Vars

Load sfr fields from log :return: loaded fields :rtype: :class: ‘lib.registry.Vars’

lock_device_off(component: str, force=False) → bool

Takes care of logic for locking off devices :param component: name of device to lock off :type component: str :param force: if true, this will overwrite any previous locks on this device :type force: bool :return: whether the device was able to be locked off (example: false if force == False and it was previously in LOCKED_ON_DEVICES) :rtype: bool

lock_device_on(component: str, force=False) → bool

Takes care of logic for locking on devices :param component: name of device to lock on :type component: str :param force: if true, this will overwrite any previous locks on this device :type force: bool :return: whether the device was able to be locked on

(only false if force == False and it was previously in LOCKED_OFF_DEVICES)

Return type

bool

log_iridium(location: tuple, signal: int) → None

Logs iridium data :param location: current geolocation :type location: tuple :param signal: iridium signal strength :type signal: int

power_off(component: str) → None

Turns off component, updates sfr.devices, and updates sfr.serial_converters if applicable to component. :param component: component to turn off :type component: str

power_on(component: str) → None

Turns on component, updates sfr.devices, and updates sfr.serial_converters if applicable to component. :param component: component to turn on :type component: str

reboot(component: str) → None

Powers a given component on and off again :param component: component to reboot :type component: str

recent_gen() → list

Returns list of input power from all bcrs :return: [bcr1, bcr2, bcr3] :rtype: list

recent_power() → list

Returns list of buspower and power draws for all pdms :return: [buspower, 0x01, 0x02… 0x0A] :rtype: list

reset() → None

Resets state field registry vars log

set_primary_radio(new_radio: str, turn_off_old=False) → bool

Takes care of switching sfr PRIMARY_RADIO field: instantiates primary radio if necessary, kills the previous radio if requested :param new_radio: string name of new radio (i.e. “APRS” or “Iridium”) :type new_radio: str :param turn_off_old: whether or not to turn off the old radio if it is being switched :type turn_off_old: bool :return: Whether primary radio was switched

True if the primary radio could be set as specified (or it already was that one). False only if it is locked off, or it’s APRS and antenna not deployed

Return type

bool

sleep(t: int) → None

Use this when you need to time.sleep for longer than 4 minutes, to prevent EPS reset Runs in increments of 60 seconds :param t: number of seconds to sleep :type t: int

sun_detected() → bool

Checks if sun is detected (JANK IMPLEMENTATION BECAUSE WE DON’T HAVE SUN SENSORS, VERY UNRELIABLE) :return: whether sun is detected :rtype: bool

switch_mode(mode: MainControlLoop.Mode.mode.Mode) → bool

Switches current mode if new mode is possible based on locked devices, returns whether mode was switched :param mode: mode object to switch to :type mode: Mode :return: whether the mode switch was executed :rtype: bool

unlock_device(device: str) → bool

Unlocks device :param device: name of device to unlock :type device: str :return: True if something had to be changed, False if it was not previously locked :rtype: bool

class lib.registry.Vars(sfr)

Loggable fields of sfr

__init__(sfr)

All variables which are logged and loaded NOTE: PLEASE UPDATE TO_DICT IF YOU ADD AN SFR VARS FIELD :param sfr: sfr object :type sfr: :class: ‘MainControlLoop.lib.registry.StateFieldRegistry’

__weakref__

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

encode() → list

Specifically for transmission of all sfr fields :return: encoded values of vars :rtype: list

to_dict() → dict

Converts vars to dictionary with encoded values Encoded values must be integers or floats!!! :return: dictionary with encoded values :rtype: dict
